titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Frank Bird Linderman's Letters to Julius C. Peters 1925-1932
Linderman (Frank Bird) Letters to Julius C. Peters
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by MarcEdit

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana--Missoula

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Frank Bird Linderman's letters to Julius C. Peters
did.abstract: Letters dated 1925-1932 from Montana writer Frank B. Linderman to Julius C. Peters discussing disbarment, the Masons, the selling of Linderman's Goose Bay residence, his writing, and a description of "wash day."

bioghist.p: Julius C. Peters was born in Shelby, Iowa, on March 31, 1887, to German immigrants. He came west to prepare for the bar at the University of Colorado, where he took the degree of Bachelor of Laws in 1910. He practiced law in Great Falls, Montana until 1921, when he entered the oil business. He was the proprietor of the Home Stake Oil Company and Resolute Oil Corporation. Julius Peters died in December 1970.

scopecontent.p: Letters dated 1925-1932 from Montana writer Frank B. Linderman to Julius C. Peters discussing disbarment, the Masons, the selling of Linderman's Goose Bay residence, his writing, and a description of "wash day."

relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the Frank Bird Linderman Memorial Collection (Mss 007) at this repository.
